body.title: Washing before prayer
body.question: True or False:

correct.answer: Washing before prayer is called wudu
correct.reason: Washing before prayer is called wudu. It is a necessary purification ritual in Islam.

body.question: Which of the following steps are part of performing wudu?

correct.answer: Washing the face
correct.reason: Washing the face is one of the steps in performing wudu.

correct.answer: Washing the hands and arms
correct.reason: Washing the hands and arms is one of the steps in performing wudu.

correct.answer: Washing the feet
correct.reason: Washing the feet is one of the steps in performing wudu.

wrong.reason: Brushing the teeth is not a step in performing wudu.

body.title: Wiping the ears
body.question: True or False:

correct.answer: Wiping the ears is part of the wudu process.
correct.reason: Wiping the ears is indeed part of the wudu process. After washing the face, one should wipe the ears with the same water used for washing the face.

body.title: Preventing water
body.question: What substances should be removed before performing wudu?

correct.answer: Nail polish
correct.reason: Nail polish should be removed before performing wudu to ensure water reaches the nails.

correct.answer: Substances blocking water
correct.reason: All substances that block water from reaching the parts being washed should be removed before performing wudu.

wrong.reason: Makeup does not need to be removed before performing wudu.
Jewelry does not need to be removed before performing wudu.

body.title: Exceptions for wudu
body.question: In which situations do you not have to perform wudu?

correct.answer: Performing ghusl
correct.reason: If you are performing ghusl (major ritual impurity), there is no need to perform wudu separately.

correct.answer: Performing tayammum
correct.reason: If the majority of your limbs are injured, you can perform tayammum instead of wudu.

wrong.reason: After using the bathroom, it is necessary to perform wudu.
Before going to bed, it is recommended to perform wudu for the night prayers.

body.title: Steps of ghusl
body.question: Put the steps of performing ghusl in the correct order.
body.components:
Make the intention for ghusl
say Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Raheem
wash hands until the wrists
wash private parts
wash any filth from the body
rinse mouth and nose properly
perform wudu
pour water and wash entire body

body.title: Obligatory Actions in Wudu
body.question: True or false?

correct.answer: Washing the face is an obligatory action in wudu
correct.reason: Washing the face is one of the obligatory actions in wudu. It is necessary to wash the entire face, from the top of the forehead to the bottom of the chin, and from one earlobe to the other.

body.title: Wiping the Head
body.question: How much of the head should be wiped during wudu?

correct.answer: At least a quarter of the head
correct.reason: Wiping at least a quarter of the head is one of the obligatory actions in wudu.

wrong.reason: The entire head does not need to be wiped during wudu.
Only wiping the hairline is not sufficient for fulfilling the obligatory action of wiping the head in wudu.

body.title: Washing the Feet
body.question: How far up the legs should the feet be washed during wudu?

correct.answer: Up to and including the ankles
correct.reason: Washing the feet up to and including the ankles is one of the obligatory actions in wudu.

wrong.answer: Only the soles of the feet
wrong.reason: Washing only the soles of the feet is not sufficient for fulfilling the obligatory action of washing the feet in wudu.
Washing the feet up to the knees is not required in wudu.

body.title: Order of Actions
body.question: What is the correct order of the obligatory actions in wudu?

correct.answer: Wash the face
correct.reason: Washing the face is the first obligatory action in wudu.

correct.answer: Wash the hands and arms
correct.reason: Washing the hands and arms is the second obligatory action in wudu.

correct.answer: Wipe the head
correct.reason: Wiping the head is the third obligatory action in wudu.

correct.answer: Wash the feet
correct.reason: Washing the feet is the fourth obligatory action in wudu.

wrong.reason: Washing the feet is the last obligatory action in wudu.
Washing the hands and arms is not the first obligatory action in wudu.
Washing the face is not the second obligatory action in wudu.
Wiping the head is not the third obligatory action in wudu.

correct.answer: Our end goal is to fulfil all the fard (essential) and wajib (obligatory) in ablution, and follow the sunnah (recommended actions)

body.title: Obligatory Actions in Wudu (Ablution)
body.question: What are the obligatory actions in Wudu (Ablution)?

correct.answer: Washing the face
correct.reason: Washing the face is an obligatory action in ablution.

correct.answer: Washing the two hands and arms, up to and including the elbows
correct.reason: Washing the two hands and arms, up to and including the elbows is an obligatory action in ablution.

correct.answer: Wiping (at least) a quarter of the head
correct.reason: Wiping (at least) a quarter of the head is an obligatory action in ablution.

correct.answer: Washing the two feet, up to and including the ankles
correct.reason: Washing the two feet, up to and including the ankles is an obligatory action in ablution.

wrong.reason: Washing the hair is not an obligatory action in ablution.

body.title: The Correct Order of Wudu (Ablution)
body.question: Put the actions of Wudu in the correct order.
body.hint: Making an intention is the first action
body.components:
Make an intention to perform wudu.
Say Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Raheem.
Wash the wrists.
Wash the face three times.
Run wet fingers through the beard.
Wash both hands up to and including the elbows three times starting from the right hand.
Wipe the entire head once, and hears with the same water.
Wash both feet up to and including the ankles three times starting from the right foot.
